main event: Five unidentified flying objects were sighted trailing, hovering, and moving rapidly over Caribou, Maine on September 25, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be moving rapidly at an estimated speed of 400-500 knots., Witnesses included pilots of a T-33 aircraft and a T-6 aircraft., One pilot described the light as being white and about 40-50 feet in diameter., The light was observed to have no vapor trail when it disappeared., Control tower operators also reported similar observations of unidentified lights.
witness description: pilots from Northeast Airlines and the USAF
